text:
Hi I'm Rima, and I have a question for
you. Now, how many times have you heard

someone say something like -  "Act your
age! It doesn't suit you otherwise."
well there're lot of  the people in this world who defie that rule, they don't act their

age and those are the ones that we call
childish adults
Welcome to today's lesson, and today's lesson is all about words used todescribe childish adults.
Now all adults at some point or the other behave like children, like kids and it's good to do so
Sometimes, once in awhile ...you know ...because it's nice treasure the child within you

so,  when you're behaving like a child
in respect of your age each these are

the words you can use to describe
yourself or someone else was doing the
same thing. So,  I have  in my list
choicest of terms and I'm going to start up with the first one which  I think is very very
familiar to almost everyone it's "Mama's Boy" how many times have you heard a

full-grown man being described as a
mama's boy, I think many many times and
it actually means - Overly dependent on your Mother.
Now, the closeness of  boy children to their moms is legendary, but once a boy grows up

into a full-grown man if he's still
calling his mom for every tiny thing and

taking all his decisions with or
without the approval of his mother then

he happens to be termed as mama's boy
and trust me
women don't date Mama's boys. Well moving on to the next one
this one is for the girls "Daddy's Girl"  Okay now "Daddy's Girl"  is someone who just

adores her father's so much that her
father has the final word on everything

she idolizes him, she wants to be like
him, She wants to do things just the way
he does it. So, "Daddy's Girl" is someone for whom her father is an ideal, so daddy can do no wrong

forties fifties but some of them are
still daddy's girl

moving on the next this one is not very
positive I'm trying to be someone who

cries at the drop of a hat, that would be
someone who cries too easily

you have a friend or colleague or sister
or someone who just cries at the drop of a hat

someone who just is like you know
waiting to tear up at every occasion and
that person can be termed as a cry baby and this one is never used in a

positive  light,  is always used
in very negative light,  to kinda show

that the person is week or does not
practice

the required emotional control. So if I have a
friend who cries too much I'm gonna say
"Don't be such a cry baby" or " You're always  such a crybaby"  and this is not a very
appreciative or positive term, so that's 'Cry baby' for you and moving on
to the next one this is ' Fidget' now 'Fidget' can be a little confusing it actually means
someone who's restless or moves continuously.
So, if you have someone , you know who just can't sit still, has to get up, has to shake his feet
has to shake his hands, well that person can be termed as a 'Fidget'. So , I can say something like
"He's such a fidget, he can't sit still for a single second" andt hat person would be the most restless

person on the face of this planet or you
could attribute the term 'Fidget' to someone who moves

continuously so if there's somebody you
know is always job jumping
or always moving houses you could say - "You're such a fidget, you can't stay still in a

job for like longer than a month and
that's the meaning of the word 'Fidget"

and that's also something you call
children because children are generally restless

always moving.. always moving from one toy 
to another, dropping things, shaking their

hands, shaking their feet and all of the
above so well you know a child is mostly

very fidgety so if an adult is behaving
like a child is termed as a 'Fidget'.

Moving on to the next one and this one
is a 'Kiddish' and this one's really simple

'Kiddish' is someone who's just acting
childish. Now, of you know somebody who's

not very mature, doesn't have very much of 
ideas about things you can actually term

that person as 'Kiddish' you
could say something like - "You have such
kiddish ideas" or " You're being so kiddish" or "You are behaving so kiddish'

which means you are  essentially behaving
and acting like a child when you are not

a child so it's okay for child to be
'Kiddish' because it's their age to be

'Kiddish' but when an adult behaves like a
child, then he's acting 'Kiddish'.

Well moving on to the next one is 'Mite' this one
can be very confusing, so I'm going to
explain to you in great detail so a 'Mite'  is actually a little child

who is a little pitiful or a
little malnourished, a little helpless
so when an adult behaves like a pitiful, helpless person that's when you term the adult as a 'Mite'

So, if someone's really indulging in
self-pity and self-sympathy and acting

all helpless despite the fact that they
are very well capable of taking care of themselves

you can just say something like "Oh don't
be such a poor mite, get you act together"

and then this term would be really
appropriate for them, so that's the
meaning of 'Mite', someone who is behaving pitiful, pathetic, helpless and that may

not be so actually, they could
actually be well capable of taking care

of themselves, but they just acting it
out like a helpless child and then that

adult would be termed as a pitiful 'Mite'.
Moving on... I have my last two words

on the list and this one's 'Tattle tale' the
other one is 'Teeny bopper'. Now  'Tattle tale' is

whole lot of fun, now  'Tattle tale' actually
means someone who is constantly complaining
I'm sure you've met many many tattle tales  in your life. So,  'Tattle tale' is actually

derived from like a classroom
environment, where children are sitting  and if

one child offends the other, the first
one is quick to go and complain to the

teacher and see that you know what this
was done to me, so someone who's

constantly complaining, someone who's not
handling his or her problems on their

own, but seeking  out authority or
seeking out help from someone else for

the same. So, well  if you have a friend
who's always telling on you or if you have

a sibling is always telling on you, you
could say like - you know.....
My brother is such a  'Tattle tale', and every time I say something to him, he has to go and

complain to my mother" This is very
relevant to children but when you grow

up and you continue to behave like
a  'Tattle tale'

like you continue to complain against
somebody... you know... to somebody that's when
you are termed as a  'Tattle tale'. So you could say something like - My colleague from the
first floor is such a  'Tattle tale'

if I say something against the boss, she's
the first one to go and actually tell him

so well that's what a  'Tattle tale' is,
somebody who tells on someone else,

somebody who complains against someone else
and essentially somebody who's not so

pleasant. So, make sure you never indulge
in being a  'Tattle tale'.  Moving on the last
one on my list ...and this one is famous as can be 'Teeny Bopper' now someone who's

'Teeny Bopper'  means someone who's
really teenagy, someone who's into like teenage

fashion, teenage music, teenage words
teenage slang, all of things that are relevant

to people who are in their teenage, but
imagine if you're a grown up like let's

say you're in your forties, late forties or 
early fifties and you still want to

dress like Hannah Montana you wanna humm
the songs that Hannah Montana sings, or

you want to use words as if you are
fresh out of middle school then you can

be termed as a 'Teeny Bopper'  - Acting like a
teenager

So, I could actually use the word 'Teeny Bopper'  in a
sentence like. you know ..... "Sally have you
checked her wardrobe, it's the wardrobe of a 'Teeny Bopper', which means Sally does not

dress according to her age, she dresses
like a teenager or something like....

"Where do get all this  teeny bopper
language from? you're a mature

professional, please speak formal language."
So,  if you're using too many teeny bopper

word you're definitely gonna hear this.
Well! that's 'Teeny Bopper' for you and I'm

going to go on my list one more time
there's 'Mama's boy' who  is overly

depended on his mother no matter what
his age there's 'Daddy's girl'  for whom daddy

is an absolute ideal her absolute ...you
know...visionary God to speak and of course there's

'Cry baby' someone who cries too easily, does
not practice the correct amount of

emotional control and 'Fidget' someone
who's restless, moves  continuously 'Kiddish'

someone who acts childish all the time
and 'Mite' someone who appears to be

pitiful and helpless but may not be
and the second last one 'Tattle tale'

someone who's always complaining and
'Teeny bopper' where someones acting like a

teenager when they're definitely not one.
Well these are the terms used to describe

childish adults and I'm hoping that... you
know... you can actually use these terms

and relate them to different people in
your environment
when we come to think of it, we see childish adults all the time, I hope you liked the
lesson, and if you have something to say to me,  do write in the comment box below
This is me Rima, saying thank you and have a great time...
